greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n whose augmented differences are a periodic word.
comment: The augmented differences aug(y) of an integer partition y of length k are given by aug(y)_i = y_i - y_{i + 1} + 1 if i < k and aug(y)_k = y_k. For example, aug(6,5,5,3,3,3) = (2,1,3,1,1,3).
A finite sequence is periodic if its cyclic rotations are not all different.
xref: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A329132.
Numbers whose binary expansion is periodic are A121016.
Numbers whose prime signature is periodic are A329140.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 10 2019
